data.enText: to smoke a cigarette, pipe, etc.

data.chText: 他（一口一口地）吸着烟斗。
data.enText: He puffed (away) on his pipe.
I sat puffing my cigar.
to make smoke or steam blow out in clouds; to blow out in clouds
Chimneys were puffing out clouds of smoke.
Steam puffed out.
to breathe loudly and quickly, especially after you have been running

data.chText: 爬坡弄得我有点喘息起来。
data.enText: I was starting to puff a little from the climb.
to move in a particular direction, sending out small clouds of smoke or steam

data.chText: 火车喷着蒸汽驶进车站。
data.enText: The train puffed into the station.
be puffed up with pride, etc.
to be too full of pride, etc.
puff and pant
puff and blow

data.chText: 气喘吁吁；呼哧呼哧地喘
data.enText: to breathe quickly and loudly through your mouth after physical effort
huff and puff

data.chText: 气喘吁吁；上气不接下气
data.enText: to breathe in a noisy way because you are very tired

data.chText: 杰克气喘吁吁地跟着她。
data.enText: Jack was huffing and puffing to keep up with her.

data.chText: 发脾气；愤然不理；生闷气；气呼呼
data.enText: to make it obvious that you are annoyed about sth without doing anything to change the situation

data.chText: 她生了好一阵闷气之后才终于同意帮忙。
data.enText: After much huffing and puffing, she finally agreed to help.
puff sth↔out
to make sth bigger and rounder, especially by filling it with air
She puffed out her cheeks.
puff up
puff sth↔up
to swell or to make sth swell
Her cheeks puffed up.
The frog puffed itself up.

data.chText: 吸，抽（把气体经口或鼻引到体内的动作）
data.enText: an act of breathing in sth such as smoke from a cigarette, or drugs
He had a few puffs at the cigar.

data.chText: 每隔四小时从吸药器中吸两口药。
data.enText: Take two puffs from the inhaler every four hours.
a small amount of air, smoke, etc. that is blown from somewhere
a puff of wind
Puffs of white smoke came from the chimney.

data.chText: 成功的机会犹如一缕青烟，瞬息即逝。
data.enText: Any chance of success seemed to vanish in a puff of smoke (= to disappear quickly) .
a hollow piece of light pastry that is filled with cream, jam, etc.
puff piece
a piece of writing or speech that praises sb/sth too much
breath

data.chText: 山坡陡峭，我很快就气喘吁吁了。
data.enText: The hill was very steep and I soon ran out of puff .

means: 吸，抽(把气体经口或鼻引到体内的动作)

ex.chText: 她看见蛇惊讶得倒抽了一口气。
ex.enText: She gasped with surprise at the snake.

ex.chText: 她浮出水面，急促地喘着气。
ex.enText: She came to the surface of the water, gasping for air.

synonyms.bx: 指因惊讶、疼痛或震惊而倒吸气，也指因呼吸困难而急促地深呼吸。

ex.chText: 在这样的高度，我们呼吸很困难。
ex.enText: We could hardly breathe at such a high altitude.
The doctor told her to breathe deeply.

ex.chText: 动物和植物都要呼吸空气。
ex.enText: Both animals and plants breathe air.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用肺等正常呼吸。

ex.chText: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢地呼出来。
ex.enText: Breathe deeply and then exhale slowly.

ex.chText: 他点燃香烟，然后吐出烟雾。
ex.enText: He lit his cigarette and exhaled smoke.

synonyms.bx: 指把吸进的空气、烟气等呼出来。

ex.chText: 那个人跑步后在大口喘气。
ex.enText: The man is gulping air after running.

ex.chText: 那个球员紧张地倒吸了一口气才回答。
ex.enText: The player gulped nervously before trying to answer.

synonyms.bx: 因体内缺氧而大口吸气或喘气，也指因害怕、惊讶而倒吸气。

ex.chText: 吸入有毒气体是危险的。
ex.enText: It is dangerous to inhale poisonous gas.

ex.chText: 他点燃雪茄，深吸了一口。
ex.enText: He lit his cigar and inhaled deeply.

synonyms.bx: 指吸入空气、烟雾、味道等。

ex.chText: 他一边爬，一边气喘吁吁。
在炎热的夏天，狗经常气喘吁吁地躺着。
ex.enText: On hot summer days dogs often lie panting.

synonyms.bx: 指因运动、天气炎热等而呼吸急促。

ex.chText: 他一边爬山，一边喘着粗气。
ex.enText: He huffed and puffed while climbing the mountain.

ex.chText: 她赶上了哈里，直喘粗气。
ex.enText: She caught up with Harry, puffing for breath.

synonyms.bx: 指因运动、干重活等而费劲地大口喘气。

data.enText: be puffed up with pride, etc.
to be too full of pride, etc.
puff and pant
puff and blow

data.chText: 气喘吁吁；呼哧呼哧地喘
data.enText: to breathe quickly and loudly through your mouth after physical effort
huff and puff

data.chText: 气喘吁吁；上气不接下气
data.enText: to breathe in a noisy way because you are very tired

data.chText: 杰克气喘吁吁地跟着她。
data.enText: Jack was huffing and puffing to keep up with her.

data.chText: 发脾气；愤然不理；生闷气；气呼呼
data.enText: to make it obvious that you are annoyed about sth without doing anything to change the situation

data.chText: 她生了好一阵闷气之后才终于同意帮忙。
data.enText: After much huffing and puffing, she finally agreed to help.
puff sth↔out
to make sth bigger and rounder, especially by filling it with air
She puffed out her cheeks.
puff up
puff sth↔up
to swell or to make sth swell
Her cheeks puffed up.
The frog puffed itself up.

tr: forceful exhalation through the nose or mouth
example: he gave his nose a loud blow
he blew out all the candles with a single puff

tr: a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke)
example: he took a puff on his pipe
he took a drag on his cigarette and expelled the smoke slowly

tr: thick cushion used as a seat
a soft spherical object made from fluffy fibers
for applying powder to the skin
bedding made of two layers of cloth filled with stuffing and stitched together
a light inflated pastry or puff shell
a short light gust of air
breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted
example: The runners reached the finish line, panting heavily
he huffed and puffed as he made his way up the mountain

tr: to swell or cause to enlarge, "Her faced puffed up from the drugs"
speak in a blustering or scornful manner

example: The critics puffed up this Broadway production
The sudden fame puffed her ego

value.def: If someone puffs at a cigarette, cigar, or pipe, they smoke it.

example.ex: He lit a cigar and puffed at it twice...
example.tran: 他点了一支雪茄，吸了两口。

example.ex: He nodded and puffed on a stubby pipe as he listened.
example.tran: 他边听边点头，还吸着一支粗短的烟斗。

example.ex: She was taking quick puffs at her cigarette like a beginner.
example.tran: 她像刚开始抽烟的人一样很快地吸着。

value.def: If you puff smoke or moisture from your mouth or if it puffs from your mouth, you breathe it out.

example.ex: Richard lit another cigarette and puffed smoke towards the ceiling...
example.tran: 理查德又点了一支烟，朝着天花板喷云吐雾。

example.ex: The weather was dry and cold; wisps of steam puffed from their lips.
example.tran: 天气又干又冷，他们嘴里哈出缕缕白气。

example.ex: He drew heavily on his cigarette and puffed out a cloud of smoke.
example.tran: 他猛吸了一口烟，吐出一团烟雾。

value.def: If an engine, chimney, or boiler puffs smoke or steam, clouds of smoke or steam come out of it.

example.ex: As I completed my 26th lap the Porsche puffed blue smoke.
example.tran: 我跑了26圈时，保时捷车冒出了蓝烟。

value.def: A puff of something such as air or smoke is a small amount of it that is blown out from somewhere.

example.ex: Wind caught the sudden puff of dust and blew it inland.
example.tran: 风猛地刮起一阵灰尘，将它吹往内陆。

value.def: If you are puffing, you are breathing loudly and quickly with your mouth open because you are out of breath after a lot of physical effort.

example.ex: I know nothing about boxing, but I could see he was unfit, because he was puffing.
example.tran: 我对拳击一无所知，但我能看出他状态不佳，因为他在急促喘息。

value.def: A puff for something such as a book, film, product, or organization is something that is done or said in order to attract people's attention and tell them how good it is.

example.ex: What is presented to the public as a critical evaluation is really an elaborate puff for him and his magazine.
example.tran: 公众所看到的评论界的好评实际上是对他和他的杂志的一种吹捧。

example.ex: He puffed the new system by showing how badly his existing system performed by comparison.
example.tran: 他通过比较，展示了当前的系统运行得如何不好，以此来吹捧这种新的系统。

value.def: A puff is the same as a poof .
